page.title: 05Portrait of a farm (NUMBER 1
page.content: This first farm is 297 acres in size.It is almost wholly within our block.It is mainly an arable farm,though 47 acres are used for the rearing of bullocks.These animals are mostly from the Continent(Charolais and Limousin), but there are some Friesians as well. There are usually 50 or more bullocks, but some have been sold to Banbury Mar ket.No more have been bought yet as corn is so expensive. The arable land is about equally divided between winter wheat,winter barley and spring barley.Yields have been low in 1985,on average half a ton per acre less than in 1984.About half the straw is burned,and half made into round bale silage for winter feed. All arable land here is ploughed before sowing.The farmer didn't believe in" this 'ere minimal cultivation".
